title: Textile, 1960
medium:
Medium: wool
Technique: knitted in stockinette stitch
description:
Large knitted hanging with white and brown figures on brown background made of four bands approximately 18" in height extending the full width of the piece and joined with a border of four 4"-bands.  The top and bottom borders are horizontal rows of alternating double candles (except for end of row - a single candle) and snowflakes, all different.  Side borders are rows of candles alternating with snowflakes, all slightly different.

Bottom band - three scenes under nine archways, left, two men in rowboat; center, boy sitting holds staff amidst two large birds, in front of two one-story houses which support oversized pots of flowers; right, two men in a boat.

Second band - scenes under archways, two men with donkey, three sleeping women, female violinist with cow.

Third band - archways framing scenes - five men, two angels, dog, cat-like beast, all paying tribute to Mary and the infant Jesus.  

Top band - two angels watching over two sleeping men; center, scene of shepherd and lambs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1960. Medium: wool
Technique: knitted in stockinette stitch. 1971-30-1.
